name: Gentiana lutea
Relationship: Compare: GENTIANA QUINQUE FLORA (intermittent fever; dyspepsia, cholera infantum, weakness); GENTIANA CRUCIATA (throat symptoms in addition to similar stomach symptoms; dysphagia; vertigo with headache; pressing inward sensation in eyes; constricted throat and head and abdomen. Distention, fullness and tightness in abdomen. Creeping over body as from fleas. HYDRAS.; NUX.

Head: Frontal headache, better eating and open air
Brain feels loose, head tender
Vertigo, worse, rising or motion; better open air
Aching in eyes
Stomach: Inflation and tension of stomach and abdomen
Colic, umbilical region sensitive to touch
Acid risings, ravenous hunger, nausea, weight and aching in stomach

details: Stomach symptoms marked. Acts as a tonic, increasing appetite.
